title: Works well, noisy water
body: It keeps the water clean, and one of my cats uses it, but the other doesn't like the noise.  The motor isn't loud but the falling water definitely is; I had to move it to a different room because the constant sound was driving me crazy.  Probably not a problem if you like the constant sound of a water trickle as background noise.  It doesn't leak if you set it up right, and I haven't had any problems cleaning it yet.

title: I am very disappointed in this product
body: I am very disappointed in this product. I had one several years ago that I liked and so did my cats. I find that this one gets moldy very quickly and doesn't stay clean enough for the cats to use. The filter gets very gunked up with slimy stuff and black stuff and the intake where the little motor is seems to hide and then spit out the same black particles. I'm not sure why. I wish this was better.

title: Drinkwell Original
body: There is no doubt about it, this product really got our two small dogs to drinking more water. Important to us because we lost a small dog to kidney failure. Most likely because she didn't drink enough water.Unfortunately, the unfiltered pump requires more cleanings than are recommended. After 26 days and two cleanings the pump seized the day I was going to do the third cleaning. :-(Fortunately, Amazon issued an instant refund and I purchased the Platinum model. That model has a pre filter on the pump.

title: Good but noisy pump motor.
body: It took our sink drinking cats ( one is 2 yrs, one is 12 yrs) about one week of staring at this on the HW bathroom floor. Now they and the small dog use it. It is quite noisy though! Not so much the running water sound but the action pump/motor reminds me of an older fishtank pump sound....I will keep it though to save from running water for the cats. The bowl is about 6 inches in diameter and about 2 in deep. It holds about twice that total.

title: Nice product but it is rather noisy and loud when ...
body: Nice product but it is rather noisy and loud when the water needs to be refilled.  My pets enjoy the fountain and drink from it without no issue

title: Five Stars
body: Works great

title: Five Stars
body: My cat is obsessed with the sink...this was the answer.

title: Kitty Loves!
body: My cat really likes this fountain. It doesn't seem to use much energy but there is a buzzing noise that I do not like. Had it about a week and so far so good.

title: Four Stars
body: My cat only likes running water and this works great. Is a little noisy but can be relaxing too.

title: HOLY MOLY this fountain is awesome!
body: I ordered this fountain to replace our 6-year-old Original Drinkwell fountain.  There was actually nothing mechanically wrong with the fountain, just that the motor had turned loud and the fountain was dirty from hard water build up.I was floored when I opened the box!  I found that the fountain had been updated to make cleaning SO easy!  (The old fountain was one, big, difficult piece to clean).I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking to encourage their pets to be healthy and drink lots of water!

title: Yes, great fountain but horrible to clean
body: This is still the best fountain I've found out there, and I've tried several. The cats love it and it's the only one they will drink from.But I'll just echo the many other reviewers who have commented on how dang difficult this thing is to clean - even with a good brush. In fact, it's really impossible to feel like you truly cleaned the whole thing because of all the little nooks and crannies.One lesson for you that I learned the hard way: Use the filters! They really do help keep it clean between washes. I originally thought I could do without the filters because I was using pre-filtered water. The water and dish were gunky in no time.

title: ithe container gets dirty really fast
body: It's okay.,,ithe container gets dirty really fast. Mildew builds up in the water holding tank.

title: Absolutely!
body: Cats LOVE it!

title: Take it or Leave it
body: Waterbowl works great, nice water feature. But of my 3 female cats, ranging from 2-9 years old, they completely ignore that it is even there. I bought the fountain thinking it could provide them with some entertainment or something to play with, watch, etc. The don't use it. They would rather drink from the regular bowl that I have for my dogs.

title: Drinkwell fountain
body: This pet fountain works very well for my cat, especially when I am away from home.  Don't have to worry about him having fresh water.

title: Necessary
body: This is a necessary item in my household!  One cat ONLY drinks from moving water.  With prime, I got the fountain the next day!  This fountain is so worth the price,

title: Great Idea, but cat won't drink from it.
body: My cat won't drink out of it. I don't know if it's the motor hum, or the moving water? The only times she will use the dish, is when it's unplugged. So, every so often, I plug it in to circulate the water, but have to unplug it to allow her to get a drink. I have even sprayed a little catnip on it to raise her interest. She smells the catnip, but won't drink. I've had this dish for a month and am giving it some more time for my cat to get interested in it. But if things don't improve, I'll have to send it back.

title: My cats love it!
body: My cats love it!!  They always used to drink water from my fish tanks, but now they drink from their own fountain.  :)

title: Good stuff
body: This product is exactly what it says it is and does what it says it does. Works very well my cat has just about stopped drinking from the faucet. The water level can run down overnight so you just need to top it off in the mornings. Other than that, it's great.

title: Finally!
body: Excellent product! Just what I was looking for. Tried a few others and found this superior. Stays clean  and fresh longer. Also the motor is quieter and the cats like the trickling fountain effect. A WINNER!!

title: the best
body: the product works very well just a little noisey when the water bowl is half full,but that prompt me to buy the 40oz attachment but thats all good

title: Four Stars
body: Filters hard drinking water for pets using charcoal packets.

title: Not the best deal.. but what do you want from a bowl.
body: Well, I should have known better than to think it was a deal.1. It's loud and noisy.2. The picture looked like it had a container for lots of water, it didn't.Since I've had it.. I run it for about 20 minutes a day because you can hear clear across the house.. But I give it 3 stars because,1. It's a decent size2. My pouda is generally happy with it.3. It doesn't leak..So there's pro's and con's with it..

title: cat likes it best when water is cold so i keep a lg ...
body: cat likes it best when water is cold so i keep a lg bottle of water i refrig for when i change water.  it only took one day for cat to get use to it.

title: This fountain is great
body: Set it ip a week ago. Greycie was driving me crazy running upstairs so I would run the water & she could drink either from the running water or the water that filled up the basin. The fountain's motor is a bit noisier than I would like but I put a small weight on the top & it's fine. Greycie didn't take to it right away but she loves it now.I cleaned it today for the 1st time. Easy enough. All in all I'm very happy w/the fountain & so is Greycie.

title: Love it!
body: Great price, fast shipping and the cats love it! Easy to clean, too.

title: You must be crazy
body: I was reluctant to buy this fountain because a few people mentioned a loud motor.  I have come to the conclusion that these people either received a defective product, or they are crazy.  The motor is barely audible.  The trickling water is what you hear.I purchased the product because even though I refreshed his water regularly, I never saw my cat drink water, or saw his water level go down. Ever.  This has not changed, however, the water level does go down, so I think he really does use it.  He expresses interest, but does not drink in front of me.  I definitely recommend this drinking fountain, but I think the reservoir is unnecessary unless you have multiple cats.  I bought the reservoir, but it never gets used before it's time to change the water.

title: Four Stars
body: Works as promised - the cats seem happy with it.

title: great item for someone who really cares about the quality ol care for their pet
body: this product came well packaged and is fairly easy to install. no splashing or leaking from the fountain. makes me feel good about the quality of water I supply for my cats health. is a little difficult to clean but if you follow the instructions on the cleaning kit available separately you can get it done

title: very happy w/ this fountain
body: Went to pick up a different brand of fountain at another store and they were all sold out. I'm actually glad now because I'm really happy with this pet fountain for my cat. Very good product for the price. It is not loud at all, just a little hum of the motor. It does start to sputter if the water level gets too low, but that's pretty standard for any water/pump mechanism. I've had this for a month now and have attempted to clean it twice... and there's been nothing to clean! I was worried after reading the reviews that this would be a problem. There are a lot of pieces and crevices, but it's not been too difficult so far. My cat was drinking from it on day one. He has had some issues with his kidneys, so I'm hoping this encourages him to drink more water. Very happy with my choice of this fountain.

title: One Star
body: Died in 3 weeks...motor went out.

title: TWO PAWS UP!!
body: My three cats love to drink out of and play in the faucet water. I was tired of turning on the water for them at least 3 times a day and forgetting to turn it off before I went to bed.  Thus, I chose the drinkwell fountain because the cats could play in the running water like a faucet.  It is excellent so far (3 months). Here is my experience with some of the problems people claim to have with the fountain:  CLOGGING:  I was worried when I read that it clogs easily. Especially because I have two long haired Persians and one short haired tabby (all of which love to shed). Contrary to what I read, I have not experienced any clogs even with all of the long hair.  NOISEY:  Some people claim that the fountain is too noisy. When it is placed on carpet I can't even hear the motor. If you have wood floors just buy a little rug. In addition, you have to fill the water up fully BEFORE pluging in the machine.  The pump will be loud and noisy and not work right if there is not enough water in it. The motor noise is a good signal to let me know when the fountain needs more water.  It is extremely bad to let the motor/pump run with out sufficient water(can damage it).  HARD TO CLEAN:  Not really. Because it is a constant flow, the water doesn't stand still to become stale and therefore does not require much attention (I clean mine about ONCE A MONTH).  If you TAKE THE MOTOR OFF then you can run the entire unit IN THE DISHWASHER.  This makes cleaning effortless and gets those hard to reach places really well.  If I do need to get into the little crevasses, I can just use an old toothbrush.  Last but not least, I read somewhere that the fountain is actually HEALTHIER FOR YOUR CATS.  The constant flow keeps water fresh and not stale.  This helps oxygenate the water to improve your cats health which in turn MAY EXTEND THEIR LIVES.  P.S. READ THE INSTRUCTIONS that come with the fountain.  It explains, right there in black andwhite that you should place unit on carpet and fill water before pluging unit in which explains ALL noise complaints.

title: PIECE OF JUNK THAT ONLY WORKED FOR 3 MONTHS!!!!
body: I guess I should have done better research before buying this piece of junk! Yet another cheaply made piece of garbage that leaked water and broke within 3 months. VERY hard to wash and keep clean, DO NOT BUY THIS PIECE OF JUNK unless you don't mind flushing your money down the toilet. REALLY should have done some research, i'm pretty disgusted with yet another cheaply made item that doesn't do what it is supposed to.

title: Another fine Drinkwell product..
body: A great replacement for the one that I had. It was a Drinkwell also. My first Drinkwell fountain ;lasted seven years and expect this one to do the same.

title: Five Stars
body: Cats love it

title: Great fountain for fussy pups!
body: My Havanese LOVES to drink from this fountain! It's quiet and I like the option to increase or decrease the water flow. It's small enough to place on our toy breed's feeding mat, too. Definitely a great addition to any spoiled dog's routine! :)

title: I have a small apartment and this one makes it sound like I have a huge waterfall
body: I wish I had taken more time to compare products. For $10 you can get their new and improved model. Which apparently is quieter. I have a small apartment and this one makes it sound like I have a huge waterfall. Plus it is blue. The photo looks light grey. My cat seems to know what to do with it but he used to use a drink well 360 until I gave it to my parents for there thirsty cats. I needed something smaller for my apartment. Now I need something quieter...

title: Cats love the fountain
body: We have 3 cats and they love to drink out of the tub spigot. We got them this so they could have a fountain to drink from and they have fun with it. Haven't noticed any loud noises. Have to keep the water at the correct level. No problems yet. So far so good.

title: Nice product but cleaning it can be a hassle
body: I originally purchased this for my 46lb lab. This Drinkwell did fine for her, no annoying splashing noises once you have adjusted the water flow to your liking, and less mess around the water bowl due to the wide design. However, when I got a second dog who was a 28lb I don't know what, I felt like I was constantly filling the container. Aside from filling it often the bigger inconvenience I realized was just turned into something else to clean. A regular dog dish can just be tossed in the sink and washed out. This thing is so big I had to take it to the bath tub to take apart and clean. You have to take the hole thing apart at least once every few weeks or it will start to grow bacteria like mold and such. There aren't several pieces but it is impossible to clean without the cleaning kit or some equivalent. After about a year I got tired of trucking this thing back and forth to clean it that it is now sitting in a closet and I am back to the plain ole' water dish. It worked great the motor was quiet, just be prepared to have to take it apart and clean it frequently.

title: Five Stars
body: Delivered as Expected

title: Problems unless filled to the brim
body: This is my second cat fountain, but I am a little disappointed. The filter is better than the cat mate, but it sputters and makes noise even when the "bowl" is a little over half full. This is one that must be topped off constantly in order for it to function quietly.

title: A good purchase especially for the price
body: The fountain replicates an open tap which compels your cat to come and get a drink here.  You can also control the flow of the stream.  Also, although it is plastic, it is BPA-free!

title: Five Stars
body: cat loves it

title: Great for picky kitties
body: I used to have a cat that "demanded" fresh ice water several times a day. This fountain has eliminated my cats constant crying for fresh water. Other reviewers have said the fountain is loud. I agree, you can hear the motor run but it is no different than a fish tank motor. It is not distracting to me. I only wish the fountain came in different colors. Great for picky kitties!

title: Great waterer for pets!
body: This is a great waterer for pets.  We have two cats and one loves to drink from the faucet.  This allows him to drink from the 'running water' as he likes and our other cat enjoys drinking from the large pan.  It's relatively quiet until the water gets low but just adding a bit takes care of that.  Dishwasher safe is awesome!  Getting the pump out for disassemble seems a bit tricky the first time but it's easy after you figure out to rotate it 90 degrees first.  Highly recommend for multiple pet owners!

title: Hope your pet will use it
body: My cat likes to drink from the bathroom faucet so I thought the fountain might be a good alternative. She used it on a daily basis for a few days but then she would only use it right after fresh water was placed into it. I checked the container after a few days and found that it felt slippery so I suspect that either the water did not remain 'fresh' because of some residue or she did not feel that the water was fresh or didn't like the taste. We gave it 2 months but it was simply too much trouble for how little she would use it. After the first cleaning which took awhile to figure out, it was pretty easy to clean and took only about 10 minutes to disassemble, clean and reassemble. It's a good alternative if your pet will drink out of it and you don't have to clean it every few days. It appears from the other reviews that most pets will use it. The cons are that unless you purchase the cleaning brushes it can be difficult to reach into the small places and, of course, there's the extra cost of purchasing filter on a regular basis. The hum from the fountain is unobtrusive in the kitchen. I suppose if the fountain was placed in a room where one wants quiet it might be annoying.

title: Quality has declined
body: What a disappointment! I bought two of these fountains several years ago. My five cats loved them. But it is hard to clean the nooks and crannies on the inside and finally they both started to leak. I ordered two new ones. One leaked significantly and the other was annoyingly loud. The manufacturer has changed the design of the motor somewhat, which seems to add to the noise. Plus the motor is wedged in so tightly it is very hard to get it out to clean it. I sent the leaking one back and ordered a different style of fountain (stainless steel, not plastic) from another vendor.

title: Does its job well for the price
body: We've had our cat for a year and he's been very finicky about water.  He never liked to drink from his water bowl.  He'd always run into a room where he heard running water though and try and drink from it, even the toilet.  That was very bothersome and gross.    Now that we have this little fountain, he is drinking from it all of the time.  I think he must finally be getting some much needed water in his diet.  I'm sure it'll help keep him a healthy cat.  Our last cat died from kidney disease.  She never had the interest in running water, otherwise maybe we'd have put two and two together.  A product like this would have probably kept her from getting that disease.    So, when I got the fountain in the mail, I did as the instructions said and flushed it out several times to remove any of the loose charcoil.  Do it until the water is clear.  Then I set it up and tried it out.  It was very very loud, as in being in other rooms and hearing it loud.  And yes, I had the water well above the intake.  That scared me.  I thought I made a bad purchase, because this was literally straight out of the box.  Well, I did the only thing I could do.  I took it all apart (as intended).  Then I ran some water through all of those areas and I put it back together.  Come to find out, that did the trick.  It was then pretty quiet.  After you take it apart once or twice you see it's not difficult.  You'll want to do that at least every 2-3 days and wash all of those few little parts that fit together out.  If there's ever anything that gets in there, a little hair, or some food, then you'll have to clean it then.  It tends to make louder noise in those cases.    Our cat does love it.  He stands on the side of it, so he can drink the falling water, like he's drinking at a water fountain.  Lately we've even caught him once in a while just sitting stairing at it.  lol  This product may have added years to his life.    If I have one recommendation for the company that makes this, it would be to give it a detachable power cord.  That would help the cleaning process a lot.

title: Drinkwell Pet Fountain
body: I loved it but my cat didn't.  So I went back to the old fashion self waterer system and she's comfortable with that.

title: Four Stars
body: Works good.

title: kitties love it.
body: My kitties love it

title: Works
body: I have my cat's food set out in the laundry room, so her water bowl can get quite dusty.  This bowl solves the problem.  However, if you place it in a dusty area like I have, you will still have to take the thing apart and wash the plastic pieces (not the electric filter) and change the water weekly.  It did take some time for my cat to warm up to this bowl, so don't expect for your cat to warm up to it instantly.  All in all, well worth the money.

title: New Motor Almost Impossible to Insert/Remove
body: PROS: Overall, we like the drinkwell fountain for our cats, and they like it too.  If we had a place to put another one, would even have a second fountain somewhere else in the apartment.CONS: Constant issues with the motor.  With the first fountain, the motor eventually broke and made a REALLY loud noise, so we bought an entire second fountain.  With this one, the motor seems to be slightly too large of a circumference for the hole it fits in, and is almost impossible to turn it and get it out.  We tried it in both the old fountain bowl and the new one and it is just not the correct size.  So now we have the choice of a loud motor or practically spraining a hand getting it in and out.It was already difficult in general to deal with the original motor with the way that there is only a tiny place to brace your hand when turning it, but this too-large-motor takes an extreme amount of elbow grease (difficult to do with nowhere to brace your hand without breaking the bowl).  Ordered a replacement motor from petsafe.com, but this is Drinkwell's last chance.  If this one doesn't work, I'm buying a completely different brand of fountain.  Lastly, a pain to take apart and clean all of the pieces, but as other reviewers have said, if you use filtered water (we always have), you can easily get away with cleaning only once a week, which is not bad.However, overall, the fountain works well (once the motor is in) and I think has encouraged the cats to drink more.  Would love to give 5 stars if the motor  wasn't always such an enormous problem.

title: My cat loves it
body: My cat loves this Fountain a finky drinker now happy uses the same bowel for a week. Filters aren't the best.

title: Broke after 3 months
body: The fountain was loud and noisy, as expected from the previous reviews, nonetheless my cat still absolutely loved it. It really did help increase his water intake. My review for this product would be spectacular, however the fountain did stop working 3 months after I purchased it. So, for that reason I would not recommend this, nor would I purchase it again. I was very disappointed that it broke so quickly.

title: popular-- when unplugged--otherwise not at all
body: I don't know how some of the other reviewers describe this as quiet-- unless mine is defective. I've had it for about a week, during which I've tried placing it on towels, blankets, in corners, etc. The well, and reserve, are full. Frankly, it's loud-- much more so than my kitchen appliances. It's also not the calming white noise of- say- a window AC unit. There's no way I would sleep with this running in the same room. My cats will drink from it, but only when it's off. When that motor is running, they won't go near it. I run it when they are outside to circulate the water, then turn it off when  they are inside. I can hear it now, running in the next room.

title: GREAT FOUNTAIN, QUALITY MADE
body: Great fountain for the price - about 1/2 price of that in the big-brand pet stores.  Has adjustable water flow (great flow!) that can be turned up or down easily.  Simple to take apart to clean.  We have a lot of minerals in our water, so I clean it about once every 2-3 weeks.  While this would last with water in it for several weeks, I like to change out the water at least once a week to keep it fresh (although the charcoal filter does a good job of that).  I have one cat in our household, but I would imagine a home that had more pets might want to change it more frequently.After some months, sometimes I notice that fur (my cat has thick, long-hair) might get caught in the pump and it will slow down some, but with this new model, the fountain is easily dismantled to get to the pump (other models weren't so easy to get to it) and give it a good rinsing.  Quick to do: takes less than 2 minutes to remove top part, get at and take out pump, rinse it off, put the pump back in and replace the top.  Easy-peasy!The water flows fairly quietly, but there is a little bit of a soft fountain water noise - which I really like.  Sounds like a far-off stream, so it is a very pleasant sound.  I know my kitty likes this fountain, because not only does she have nice, clean water all the time, but she liked to drink from the faucets before (which I didn't really care for) and now with the fountain, she'll drink directly from the water coming out of the spout so she is happy.  :-)I have had this same brand before (but in a larger size reservoir), and liked it well enough that this is my 3rd purchase over the past many years.  I have tried other brands/types, but I like this one the best as there is no dripping or leaks (from the unit... when we had the dog, he would lap the water messily and drool/drip it all over the place - not due to any malfunction of the fountain though).This is a well-made and sturdy unit; if/when I ever need to replace it, I would get the same one again.  Very happy with the quality and materials.

title: At first I hated it, it made a lot of sound and ...
body: At first I hated it, it made a lot of sound and the cat was scared of it. Then my husband worked on it and it started making less sound, and after 1 month the cat finally gathered the courage to drink from it.Would I buy it again? I am not sure, but it now does the job that I bought it for.

title: I had one I've been using for 4 years + and it is still working great, just some calcium build up that is very ...
body: I bought this around Christmas when it was the deal of the day. I had one I've been using for 4 years + and it is still working great, just some calcium build up that is very hard to clean so I thought I'd start fresh. I am not sure the one I received is not a counterfeit. There are none of the markings of Drinkwell that my previous one had. The whole thing seems a cheaper quality. I'm reading the reviews of others saying it leaks. I'm going to watch for that. I never had that problem with my old one but would not be surprised with this one. I'm thinking of going to PetSmart to check out the design of the ones they carry. Wish I had taken it out of the box and set it up when I first received it because I would be returning this.

title: Updated version even better than the older models
body: Updated version even better than the older models, and easier to clean.  Everything comes apart so you have easy access.  Love it!

title: clean water
body: I bought this Drinkwell because my cats were always playing in their water. Now they have fresh filtered water at all times and do not play in it anymore to get fresh water. I think it is amazing. I then bought one for my Sister and her pets for Christmas since I liked mine so well!

title: NOISY
body: Funny how they said it would just be the trickling water sound - the motor is RIDICULOUSLY loud :(Very disappointed.

title: so so
body: While the overall concept is good, I have had problems adjusting the water flow.

title: Works , but too noisy for skittish cats
body: works but it scares our cat , maybe our new kitten will like it better, the water evaporates after a few days if you don't refill

title: Great for Cats
body: My cats love drinking out of this.  I don't know why, but they prefer it to drinking out of a bowl.  Considering how cats are notorious for not drinking enough, this fountain is great for getting them to drink water.

title: Five Stars
body: works well

title: Buy this for your cat or small dog!
body: I am are very happy with it and can only recommend it.

title: Works Gret
body: We purchased the Drinkwell Original Pet Fountain in February 2009, and we have used it with two different cats.  It has worked perfectly and is still going strong.  It cleans great in the dishwasher.

title: Bummed
body: REALLY loud motor.  Not something to be used in a small space.  If its outside or away from your regular living space its OK.  But not made for a small apartment or home

title: Great space saver cat now has the illusion of continual ...
body: Order came early yeah! Great space saver cat now has the illusion of continual running water absolutely love this product.

title: there is a constant low hum and the water sounds like a faucet that has not been closed properly
body: This fountain is very noisy, there is a constant low hum and the water sounds like a faucet that has not been closed properly. The flow control knob does not work and I have only seen my cat drink from it one time.

title: My cats love this fountain
body: My cats love this fountain! They are prone to waiting by the sink to drink from the dripping faucet, but leaving the water running for them is in poor taste due to the extreme drought we are currently experiencing in California. This fountain not only keeps their water flowing constantly, but also keeps it free of debris and seems to encourage them to drink more often.

title: Great fountain, cats love it!
body: I've had this fountain for almost a month and I think it's great. One of my cats really like to drink out of the faucet in the bathroom sink and this seems like a good replacement for him. He drinks right out of the spout where my other cats like to drink out of the bottom. I have had no problem with cleaning or clogging. It does make a weird sound when the water level gets too low (this is why I gave 4/5 stars), but I try to add fresh water to it everyday. Of course the fountain is not totally silent but the noise is not enough to bug me, it's a quiet hum with the sound of running water. I would recommend this fountain to cat owners, really great fountain for the price!

title: Unit works as advertised, but cat doesn't really care for it.
body: Seems to be working well so far, when on full blast it is a little loud with the splashing but on low you can only hear the motor. Unfortunately my cat doesn't care for it, which is surprising because he loves to drink directly out of the faucet.

title: Nothing special, I would not buy again!
body: One of the photos of this item shows it with a large water source on the back of the unit; it is NOT included! It does not state in the information that it is not included (minus one star). The directions say you should preform extensive pump cleaning every two weeks. My old unit did not require this much attention and lasted 5 years! The pump is MUCH noisier than my old unit (minus another star). For the price this unit is just OK!

title: works.
body: works. My cat loves the waterfall. I got this with the bonus water storage.

title: Great Product!!
body: After having owned several of the Drinkwell Original Pet Fountains, the latest fountain is the best as they have made improvements over earlier units. No need to remove the water flow stem as the back wall pops off exposing the "pump" which is more accessible for cleaning. My cats "love it". Great product and much cheaper on Amazon than the retail stores! Thanks Amazon!!!

title: its okay..
body: my cat really did not pay attention to the fountain. im not sure if its because she prefers to drink still water or is not very interested by moving, streaming water. i think it would be a great product for someone else but my cat really did not show too much interest in it.

title: Made No Difference
body: My cats avoided it at first. I had to let it sit out for a few days NOT running, for them to get used to it. Now, they don't care if it runs or not. I purchased it to encourage my cat to drink more water (websites suggested this to help w/bladder infection), but she does not drink anymore than she used to. A lot of money for a fancy water bowl. I use it now because it filters the water, but I also run their water through a Brita filter before I fill the bowl, so the filter really isn't even necessary for me.

title: Doesn't filter well
body: It's not noisy, it looks nice, and it doesn't splash. However, it doesn't do its main job well. The filter is just too weak. My dogs come in with dirt from our backyard and the dirt just got sucked down to the bottom of the bowl, but not sucked back into the filter. For me, it's better to just change their water a couple times a day in a regular dish rather than keep this system.

title: awesome product
body: Worked great up till couple months ago .. keeps crapping out does it have warranty ? I clean it all the time

title: Great for the running water loving cat
body: I love this little fountain. My cat, Feebie is a water cat. She loves to drink from thebathroom sink and tub. I needed some way to give her what she likes, running water, while keeping her out of my bathroom.This fountain has been a life saver. She loves it. She gets running, filtered water all day long.The only thing I wish it did was also keep the water cool. But I guess I could have upgraded for that option.Well worth the money though.

title: Works great, wonderful idea
body: Molly just loved it and so do I. The water is fresh and clear and she is drinking freely which is great. She will only drinking from flowing water like so many cats.

title: Cats Love it BUT...
body: It is a wonderful concept and my cats Love it...BUT...I have had 2 units crack where the pump motor "screws" into the housing. There is a  seam in the plastic housing that opens up when attempting to remove the pump for cleaning or when attempting to replace the pump after cleaning. I no longer attempt to remove the motor when cleaning and my 3rd unit is running fine still 9 months later.

title: not worth the money
body: I am disappointed with this water fountain/filter.  The water needs to be replaced every 2 days and the filter taken apart and cleaned or the water starts to froth and the inside of the bowl gets slimy.

title: but now the love it and drink a lot more water
body: it took the cats a day to understand , but now the love it and drink a lot more water:)

title: It works great and was shipped fast
body: I bought this for my boyfriends cat. It works great and was shipped fast.

title: Don't buy, waste of your money
body: Purchased this product for my cat for Christmas 2014 and pump went out in February 2015.  Very disappointed with this product.

title: a good product, but not for purchase outside of USA
body: The product itself looks great, if only i was able to plug it in! i just had a blonde moment and forgot that USA outlets are different to Australian ones, and to purchase a transformer was going to cost an extra $80.   I ended up buying a whole new system for $60 at pet barn.   Look out for my (unused but unboxed) drinkwell on ebay soon!

title: My CAT is happy
body: He loves drinking from and watching the waterfall. I am happy that the water continues to cycle so it doesn't become stagnate. I also like that it has a filter so I can use regular tap water (though I boil his water first in a teapot and then when it has cooled use that water). I received my Drinkwell fairly quickly from what I remember (I'm a little late writing this review) and it was well packaged.

title: Cat Hated It
body: My cat hated this contraption. I immediately turned it off, put it back in its packing material and returned it to Amazon. I think it was the noise (it's very noisy) plus the waterfall (the water falls from about 2-3 inches) that got her. I have had cats that loved this item, but not Buffy and I am writing on her behalf. She looked like she thought she'd never have water again. She gave me her happy purr when we returned to her regular stainless steel water dish. All is well.

title: Doesn't look like a winner
body: I went back and forth on buying this for our newest 4 year old calico rescue.  Now I wish I would have stayed back.  It just came today and we eagerly cleaned it and set it up.  Enter curious kitty.  Fiona walked right over to it and put her head in a little to take a closer look and got water on the top of her head from the fountain part that I had set on the lowest setting.  Exit wet headed kitty.  I can't see this being a hit, but we'll see.  My sister has 4 cats and several of them love to drink from the bathroom sink that they let dribble for them.  For that kind of cat, I think this would be an excellent choice.  For our Fiona I think we'll have to stick to a boring water bowl.  I guess she doesn't look for adventure when she drinks ~ sigh ~

title: Claen pump regularly
body: Make sure to do regular cleaning of the pump/impeller or you'll look at early pump failure

title: Five Stars
body: Kitty loves it.

title: my cat loves it she is 19yrs old so it ...
body: my cat loves it she is 19yrs old so it took her about an hour to warm up to it now she likes to slap at the water as it comes out.

title: Quality at a Great Price
body: We bought this to replace a pet fountain from a competitor. This was at about the same price point, but the quality here is much better. The whole fountain is designed in a way that is very easy to keep clean. The large bowl allows for both of our cats to drink at once. Despite the large bowl, it doesn't take up much more room than their food dish... they've done a great job of designing upward rather than out. The filter is the easiest I've come across to change, as well. Just simply pull it out from the top and slide in a new one! I like the ability to adjust the flow. My only complaint is that it can be a bit loud. It gets a loud buzzing-type sound when the water gets to about halfway down the bowl. It's a great reminder that we need to refill, but it can be annoying when it starts in the middle of the night. ;) Overall, I would definitely recommend and would purchase from Drinkwell again.

title: Not great for medium dogs
body: The design is flawed, if your dog leaves behind drool. It collects on the opposite end of the filter and doesn't circulate. The charcoal filter doesn't fit and I'm not sure if it really works. The biggest problem is my dog won't drink from it after he drinks from it. Tried the bigger options with similar results the pump is too small and they all have similar design flaws. Going back to a regular bowl.

title: Very quiet
body: I have had 2 prior Drinkwells. This one is easier to clean, quiet to run & over all a really great product. Mt 2 cats & 1 dog all use it!

title: It's 'ok'
body: I bought this with the interest of moving water. My cat seems to only like to drink fresh moving water. Before this fountain I left the sink on a trickle so he would drink. Cats don't like 'stale' water (as I was told by my vet). The fountain was noisy at first but once it started cycling it went quiet and the sound of the moving water was actually soothing. Then I got a dachshund. She drinks a lot because she plays a lot and when the bowl is only half full the fountain becomes noisy. I'm always pouring a cup of water back into it which I don't mind, I just hate how noisy it gets, you can hear it all over the house.  The reason I dislike it now is it is very hard to clean. The back part where the filter goes has a lot of tiny spaces and corners and my hand doesn't fit inside. I stick it in the dishwasher but there is still a slimy feel to the inside because it needs to be scrubbed. I bought little bottle brush scrubbers but those don't get the corners too well. This thing is just a pain to clean. I live in a place with very hard and mineral filled water. The plastic design for this is not a good idea. Once a week when I clean the whole thing I have to take a steak knife and scratch off all the white hard build up (and its hard to see because of the colour of the fountain, but I can feel it.)  Overall it's a nice little fountain, it just gets a little noisy when it needs to be refilled and is a pain to clean.

title: not at all durable
body: I bought this drinkwell pet fountain with the 70 ounce reservoir for my cat. I was very pleased at first, it didn't have the loud noise that some reviews mentioned, depending on the setting you put it on it was very silent or just had a water splashing sound (I always had it on que quietest setting). Once I set it up, my cat was more than excited. It did make him drink significantly more water and he stopped harrassing me everytime I walked into the bathroom (he likes flowing water). Anyway, about 3 months later the thing just stopped working all together. I called drinkwell and they sent me a replacement for the power supply, apparently it burnt out for no reason. Again it worked fine despite the corrosion from the water and the hair buildup that seems impossible to clean given all the straight edges that are not easily accessible. It's been about six months since I bought the fountain and now it just has tiny drips of water on the highest setting. It no longer atracts my cat to drink more water because the water is not streaming out of it and the plastic looks very bad despite my best efforts to keep it clean. I was hoping to buy something that would last me much longer than this, I am very disappointed.

title: Drinkwell - My cat said he wanted a new one Meow
body: I was one of the first customers of Drinkwell Pet Fountains, I remember I called the Owner, the vet and talked with her about her new product.  It has to be more than 10 to 15 years ago that I got my first fountain.  Well I needed a new motor, the fountain was leaking because of the seal on the motor.  They wanted to sell me a new motor for $18.00.  But Drinkwell updated their product, and got smart and got a new motor design.  It is smaller, much easier to remove.  I mean the old motor was really a pain to remove.  This new motor is much smaller and they did some redesign how it screws into the unit.    So the old Drinkwell has been retired and I got this new one from Amazon at an Amazing price.  The new Drinkwell is running and I don't hear a thing.  Leo, my little buddy, checked out his new possession and gave me a thank you meow.  I have always loved the Drinkwell, I cannot give this a better recommendation, that I bought a new one, after so many years.  The best investment I could make for my little furry friend.

title: Noisy
body: Even thought the product itself worked fine, the Cats were afraid of the loud motor running the water flow, I do not recommend if your cats are afraid of noises..

title: No clogs for my kitties
body: This fountain works great!  Unlike other reviewers, I haven't had any problems with it clogging.  I clean it out every week or so, but just with a washcloth---no special pipecleaners or anything.  I have two cats, and they both love the fountain; I can finally go to the bathroom without them pawing on the door to get water out of the faucet!

title: Mehhh, not really worth it in my opinion
body: Decent looking, but the filter needs constant changing. Pet hair gets trapped in it and I would recommend cleaning it at least every other day. Too high maintenance for my taste. My cat didn't really care for it either.

title: Broken
body: Delivered with a crack at the bottom where the motor connects, this was not a new product, which is what I ordered.  Water spilled all over the floor.  Not happy with Sarco!

title: Three Stars
body: Worked well, but required cleaning and changing the filter every week.  I found it hard to clean.

title: I'm happy I purchased this one
body: Lightweight simple fountain that both my cats have taken to drinking from. The charcoal filter leaves small amounts of black soot at the bottom of the bowl, so I took it out, as I used filtered water anyway. The motor is a quiet hum, but the trickling water can be heard throughout the apartment. You get used to it. The flow adjustment knob hardly changes the flow at all. All in all, I'm happy I purchased this one.

title: Large capacity, but noisy motor.
body: My cat has taken to the fountain like a fish to... well, water. I like that the fountain has a large 50-oz capacity and adjustable output. I set it towards the lower end because my cat likes to splash. The set up was also easy. However, the motor is pretty noisy. The whine of the motor drowns out the pleasant waterfall sound of the fountain itself. I have a small apartment where the fountain is near my bedroom, so I turn it off at night. The noise doesn't seem to bother my cat, though.

title: Fountain of middle-aged cats
body: Thke cats love it and use it regularly. An earlier fountain worked as well, but was really noisy. Problem solved.

title: the price is great, except it will need cleaning at least every ...
body: considering most fountains don't last for only a few years, the price is great, except it will need cleaning at least every 2 to 3 weeks.  My other motor stopped working all together and replacement of the motor was way too expensive.  Cheaper to just buy the whole unit as I did.  Cats love it.

title: Three Stars
body: Good idea but my cat hates it

title: Good investment if your cats prefer running water
body: My cats haven't seemed to take a preference over this with the other water dispenser I have. I bought the fountain because they seemed to want to drink out of the faucet in my sink and I took that to mean that they were thirsty for running water. As we know, cats are finnicky, and mine just went back to drinking from the old water dispenser despite the fact that the fountain is right next to it. I don't know if they're uncertain what to make of it, or if they're just trying to annoy me. :) At any rate, it works well, isn't too noisy (imagine a fountain) and certainly seems to keep the water fresh. I bought the reservoir, too, since it seemed to run low on water every 3 days or so without it. Good product.

title: Marvelous product, highly recommended, except.....
body: My cats love this fountain. Our first Drinkwell fountain was in constant use for about 3 years until it was inadvertently stepped on and broken beyond repair. Two cheap replacements only lasted 8 and 3 months, respectively. I bought another Drinkwell fountain in July, 2010 through Amazon and after a year and a half, it's still working just fine. I take it apart every 3-4 weeks to clean it thoroughly and replace the filter.  The ONLY problem I have with it - which resulted in 4 instead of 5 stars - is that the pump is very hard to remove for cleaning. And it DOES need to be cleaned. It necessarily attaches in a very tight, leakproof seal, but is situated in such a way as to make it very, very difficult to detach from its housing. If there was more space allowed to apply sufficient leverage to remove the pump more easily, I'd have given this fountain 5 stars. Btw: re-attaching the pump is no problem.

title: Five Stars
body: Cats love it. Old man hates it

title: started leaking within a month
body: The unit started leaking water where the pump connects to the bowl about a month after I bought it. I removed the pump (as per the instruction manual), cleaned the unit while looking for anything that could have caused a leak, reassembled and refilled the unit, and within an hour I had a puddle of water under the motor again. I had to disconnect the unit and stop using it. I hope I can find my Amazon receipt to return it.

title: My Cats Love It!
body: I wanted to encourage my kidney patient cat to drink more water and he loves this fountain. Whenever it gets a little noisy, I add more water to the level and/or unplug and replug it...usually corrects. Easy to clean with a bottle brush.

title: Five Stars
body: My kitties love having their own drinking fountain!

title: Its fair, after your pet takes a couple of ...
body: Its fair, after your pet takes a couple of drinks, u have to keep filling it up, not worth the hassle, wud  not recommend

title: very cool.  Cat loves it
body: My daughter loves it.  So does her cat

title: Gets the job done
body: I bought this in a desperate effort to keep my cat from waking me up in the middle of the night to turn on the bathroom faucet for her but it hasn't worked. The fountain functions perfectly fine (it's a tad loud) and my other cat drinks from it but I'm still woken up in the middle of the night by my little prissy pants. Turns out she just likes the attention I give her while she's sitting on the sink. Go figure.

title: Great, but like the Bubbler better
body: I bought one of these Drinkwells through Amazon. I got the optional resevoir and cleaning kit and with shipping it cost me $70. The Drinkwell has a relatively loud pump noise that comes from under the bowl part which spooked the cats the first few days (ands drives me nuts so I have to unplug it at night even though it's three rooms away from my bedroom). Once they got over the noise, the cats loved it so much that I would have liked a second (I have multiple food/water stations) but the price made that impossible.The other day I was at my local grocery store and they had a similar product called the Bubbler for $14.99. I couldn't believe it and snatched one up.Let me say, the Bubbler is not only considerably cheaper, but holds more water than the Drinkwell, is easier to clean than the Drinkwell and is quieter than the Drinkwell. I so regret spending that much money on the Drinkwell now.The Bubbler air pump is not in the bowl, it connects to it by a hose so the little bit of noise from it is far enough away as to not spook the cats. All you really hear from the Bubbler is the bubbling water which reminds me of those water fountains people put in their homes now.The Drinkwell pump is in the back of the bowl and it recirculates the water so you hear the pump itself and then the running water sound. As it pulls water from the bowl and recirculates it, any pet hair or dropped food that goes into the bowl gets pulled into the inlet and clogs it. Some hair goes right through these little pieces and then clogs the pump. I pulled a big hair clog out of the center of the pump already. Plus it uses filters so there's that extra cost. I have run it without the filters, so that is an option.There's only three pieces to clean in the Bubbler, the bowl and tank/lid, and they go in my dishwasher. The Drinkwell has 4 major pieces, 2 lids, three small pieces, and the pump itself which need to be cleaned with the brushes by hand.The Drinkwell is great and the cats do like it, and I would have gladly given it 5 stars prior to owning the Bubbler, but that would have been based soley on cats loving it and not because I had any true basis for comparison. Now I have two to compare and so my Drinkwell is no longer all that great. Even if they dropped the price in half, I'd still get another Bubbler just for the ease of cleaning and the water capacity it holds.brushes by hand.  The Drinkwell is great and the cats do like it, and I would have gladly given it 5 stars prior to owning the Bubbler, but that would have been based soley on cats loving it and not because I had any true basis for comparison. Now I have two to compare and so my Drinkwell is no longer all that great. Even if they dropped the price in half, I'd still get another Bubbler just for the ease of cleaning and the water capacity it holds.

title: Great product
body: Cat loves it, easy to clean and maintain.  It's a must for any cat who enjoys drinking water from the tap. Instead get this and the cat will stop jumping on your sink!

title: Five Stars
body: great

title: Love it, but forgot to tell the catsitter
body: My cats and I love the Drinkwell Original Pet Fountain.  We are on our second fountain.  Unfortunately I didn't unplug it when I went on vacation, didn't tell the cat sitter that it needed to be filled up regularly and when I came home 6 days later, the motor no longer worked. In fact I have a cat that lies beside the fountain like he expects the water to start running anytime.  Now I could kick myself for throwing the old motor out (it was old and noisy, but still worked).  I would love to just replace the motor as I just started using the fountain a month ago. Found a site that sells the motor, but it is almost as much as buying an entire new fountain, so I am debating the purchase.

title: Too Loud
body: This is the loudest pet water syatem. I drove me crazy. The adjustable level was useless. All plastic construction.

title: Our cats love having running water
body: Our cats love having running water, no more jumping into the bathroom sink and waiting for someone to turn on the faucet for them!  We did have to buy a reservoir to add the the amount of water it holds.

title: therefore I thought this would be awesome. Well
body: I got exactly what I asked for.... my cat hates it.  she loves to drink water from faucet, therefore I thought this would be awesome.  Well....I have to sleep with one eye open.  She gives me dirty looks because I won't open faucet now and just send her on her way.  She has even tried to tilt fountain over.  So far she has not succeeded, it just ends up in middle of floor with water spilled around it.  That's what I get for spoiling her ;0/

title: Five Stars
body: My cat love it

title: really noisy
body: I had a petmate fountain that cracked and was looking for a replacement. This looked and sounded good. I read the reviews and thought 'how noisy could a cat fountain be?'. I expected a hum to the motor. Then I plugged it in and realized that the motor is insanely loud. It's not a hum. The cat is terrified of it and I can't say that I blame him. Luckily, he's pretty good about drinking water so I am going to try to 'make it work' by running the motor and circulating the water primarily when he's outside. However, I'm sure I'll end up buying another one before too long, and I'll buy the petmate one I had before. It was impossible to clean but it was quiet.

title: clean fresh water for my cats
body: my cats love it , seems to be a little harder to clean ,but it works great

title: Cats love this fountain
body: I've had this fountain about 7 months. I clean it approx every 4 days by soaking in a mixture of white vinegar and water. My cats prefer spring water. My cat pawed at his old water bowl, splashing water all over the floor. When I switched to this fountain and used spring water, he no longer paws. The cats enjoy drinking from the fountain. A great, well made product. Not too difficult to take apart and clean.
Thumbs up. I love it. It keeps the water moving constantly. This keeps the micro organisms from building up. Love it.

title: Four Stars
body: Works great, a little bit noisy, but any pump motor is. The cats took right to it.

title: Fragile
body: Our cat came to enjoy this fountain after about a month or 6 weeks of ignoring it. Unfortunately, the motor is extremely difficult to remove for cleaning. We followed the instructions carefully and didn't use anything except a finger to pry the motor out--no easy task. Nevertheless, the plastic case for the motor cracked after only 8 or 10 cleanings, causing the fountain to leak like a sieve. It's irreparable and ruined. That's a shame, because it's a good product otherwise; but I will not buy another.

title: Every cat deserves a stream
body: Works well and my cat loves it. Drinks more water because of it too

title: Great buy!
body: This has been one of the best purchases I've ever made for my cats.  I've had this particular model for four or five years now, and it's still going strong!  Just keep the water filled, the fountain clean (debris and lose fur will get caught up in the filter), and this running water bowl will last a long time!

title: Over the years, all of our cats love this fountain
body: We have had one of these Drinkwell Original Pet Fountains for many years.  Our previous favorite cat of all time, was not so fond of the running water part, but would approach and drink from the basin.  Our current cat has been enjoying it for over twelve years.  She sits next to it and wets her paws in the running water then licks them clean.  If the water entering the pump makes noise, unplug and plug it back in.  It may take several times, but once there is no cavitation, you should mainly hear the water hitting the diffuser.  One family member tried cleaning ours without asking how, or reading the instructions.  It was easy to order replacement parts, and get the fountain back in working order.  I don't know if this model is dishwasher safe like the new one, but we highly recommend this model.

title: Drinkwell fountain
body: My cats love to drink out of the faucet and this fountain makes a wonderful substitute with running water available all of the time.  Highly recommend it.

title: Kitties love this. Next one would hold more water
body: Kitties love this.  Next one would hold more water.

title: Great product!
body: I purchased this, recommended by my vet, because my cat was dealing with digestive issues due to dehydration.  He loves drinking out of sinks so it made sense to get him a fountain. It took a few days for my cat to get used to it but he loves it! This is a great product, its a great deal!  I recommend it!

title: ... second one the first one lasted tens years a great
body: This is my second one the first one lasted tens years a great product

title: Ok overall
body: I got this to replace a Cat Mate fountain that didn't have the waterfall.  The first one I got had a crack in the plastic so it leaked, but I was able to exchange it with no problems. The second one seems to work fine, but the motor is a little louder than the Cat Mate one.

title: Awesome! In one word
body: Awesome!  In one word, my cat loves drinking from it as the water flows! Great deal as well and pretty compact in size, which does not take up a lot of space. I highly recommend this product to anyone who has need for their small dog or cat.

title: The Cat Absolutely Loved This Fountain
body: When my daughter-in-law asked for this drinking fountain for their 2 yr. old male cat, I thought it was a gimmick.  But when we set it up on X-mas Eve, the cat was virtually at the water fountain every few seconds.  He absolutely loved it!!  We had put down a bowl of water for him when they first arrived, and the cat would have nothing to do with the 'well' water...tried to bury it a number of times, LOL!!  But not with the Drinkwell fountain.  The filtered water was fresh, and the motor ran quietly.  I also bought the reservoir so as not to have to fill it as often.  I see now that there is a cleaning kit to facilitate keeping the fountain pristeen.  I believe I'm going to order one of those, since the fountain is such a success!!!  If you have a cat(s), this is absolutely a must!!!  Thanks for stocking this excellent item.

title: Good Product
body: My cat loves it. I had my doubts when I bought it, but overall great product. Will buy again in the future.

title: The Kitty Loves It
body: My cat was notorious for knocking of glasses of water, jumping in the tub after showering and sitting in the sick all so that he caould get some truly fresh water. This fountain has satisfied his quench. It is non-intrusive, easy to clean and the cat loves it! He even figured out how to change the water flow. The flowing water sound takes some getting used to because I thought I was leaving the sink on the first few days. I would highly recommend this product for the health and happiness of your pet.

title: Great fountain
body: I got this fountain because one of my cats insists on drinking running water; she'll sit at the sink and beg until I let it trickle so she can drink. She loves this fountain. My other cat is not nearly as picky, and he just drinks from the pooled water in the bowl, but he has not had any problems with this. The only downside I have found is that the fountain is relatively loud, so you constantly hear water pouring. It's really not a big deal, but it may bother some people.

title: Cats Love It
body: Love this product!  My 2 cats will not drink water unless it's coming from this fountain.  The price was fantastic and was received practically the next day after ordering.

title: I love it, my cat loves it
body: I love it, my cat loves it.  I solved the wanting to drink from the kitchen faucet problem! It is easy to clean, makes no noise. My cat and I could not be happier.

title: Great!  All my cats love it!
body: We've tried several other drink fountains and this is the one my cats prefer!  Just add more water to the bowl to keep it going.  I tried the catgrass add-on but my cats didn't get into it.

title: MUST HAVE if you love your pets!
body: This is probably the best thing I've ever bought in my life. My cat loves it! So does my doggy! It's big enough that they can both share it, and it works as described and provides my animals fresh, lovely flowing water. The only gripe I have is the sound of the water flow- it is kinda loud. I remedied that by putting a few rocks on where the water falls, so that it doesn't make the loud watery flowing sound (scrubbed the rocks clean before placing them in, of course) .10/10 , MUST HAVE for your pet if you really love your animals!

title: Ok pet fountain
body: I have had this pet fountain for about a year and a half. I got it for my cat because I thought she would like the running water (she loved drinking out of the sink).After having it this long I'm not sure I would buy it again - partly because my cat's preferences have seemed to change and partly because of the hassle of cleaning and maintaining this fountain.I clean it fairly often but after this amount of time with it running constantly, the plastic has begun to feel rough and porous around the water line, making it harder to get the bacteria off. It is also not the easiest thing to clean and one specific frustration is trying to get the motor out of the back (it is really hard to twist out in the confined space especially with wet hands). Also I feel like the filters are made a weird shape specifically so you cannot buy a simple rectangle carbon filter. Also there is a fine line to this fountain between full and too low where the machine makes a horrible sound.I have seen other fountain designs and believe my cat may have liked a different flow pattern and probably a ceramic fountain better. At this point my cat rarely drinks out of the fountain, although she did drink from it in the beginning I wouldn't say she was overly hydrated because of it and still begged for other sources of water.Overall, I wish this fountain was lower maintenance (easier to clean) and that it held up longer for the price and the price of filters.

title: Love it!
body: My new "rescue" cat that I got from a local shelter had been refusing to drink except from my bathroom sink faucet; she'd jump up and would drink every time she heard the water running.  She wouldn't touch water from a dish although I tried several different kinds.  I gave this a shot, and I was so relieved when she immediately took to the Drinkwell Pet Fountain!  Interestingly, she drinks out of the bowl part and not from the spigot as I thought she might do.The filter as well as the water movement keeps the water clean and fresh and I find the unit very easy to clean and maintain.  I would highly recommend it.

title: Okay at first, but became too hard to keep clean
body: This pet fountain worked okay at first, but after a few months, it was impossible to keep clean. The pump would get clogged with gross black stuff, and it was almost impossible to clean out. Then that gunk would get into the water. Cleaning it daily didn't even help. I finally had to stop using it and go back to a bowl.

title: Not Adjustable Enough
body: I bought this to replace an older Drinkwell fountain, the one with the motor underneath the bowl. I ordered a new fountain, because I was getting so tired of trying to clean all the nooks and crannies, so I tried boiling two of the plastic parts. I'm here to tell you, don't do that! I wasn't sure if I was going to ruin the parts or not by boiling them, but I ruined the lever that is used to adjust the flow of the fountain, so I ordered a new fountain. The new fountain is similar to my old one, but what didn't work for my cats, was that I couldn't lower the flow of the water enough for my cats. It almost seemed that the lever in this fountain did nothing if you turned it one way or the other and I think the water flowing too quickly scared my cats, I tried to get them used to the new fountain, but after a few days, I gave up and I'm using the old fountain that I sort of ruined, because with that one, the flow of the water is lower (and doesn't scare the cats). I didn't want to take chances thinking, if they get thirsty enough they'll drink from the new fountain, because one of my cats had bladder stones, which is why I had originally purchased a fountain in the first place.

title: Pet Fountain
body: This is the second fountain I've bought for my cats.  The original fountain died after only a short time.  This fountain is durable, quiet and easy to use.  My cats love it and drink a lot of more water than they did with just a regular bowl of water.  When purchasing the fountain, I highly recommend purchasing the reservoir also.

title: My cat loves it and he's REALLY hard to please!
body: My cat loves it and he's REALLY hard to please with his water.  I thought it was pretty expensive for a water bowl, but it's been worth it for us.  He used to beg (loudly) for 'fresh' water all day long.  (His idea of 'fresh' was our decorative fountain, the fish tank, the toilet, the hot water from the bathtub or some immediately from the sink!  I figured out that he really likes movement to his water.  When I slowly stirred the water in his old dish, he would drink it.  This gives me days of peace until it needs to be cleaned.  I use distilled water so that it won't breakdown with minerals, but I have to remember to always have some on hand.

title: So far so good, but I've only had it a few days
body: So far so good, but I've only had it a few days. I will come back with more later.

title: pet fountain
body: This water fountain is a must for a pet owner that keeps their pet inside. It will hold about a quart of water. The water is pumped through a charcoal filter to keep it clean. If you want to give your pet a cold drink just drop some ice in the water tank and you have cold water for your pet.

title: Highly recommend this for any beloved pet
body: My dog was afraid of it at first. I won't purchase used again... He could smell "other dog" on it. But he's using it now, and having the water circulation keeps it from stagnation and is healthier for him. I should have gotten one long ago!

title: cat did not use it
body: concept is great, but my cat did not use it.  It makes a loud humming noise that scared him away.  Also, it does not cool the water.  If you keep it on all day, and your animal does drink, the water will run low and the motor gets even louder.  Looking for another alternative

title: Very nice fountain. I'm a huge fan of the Drinkwell ...
body: Very nice fountain. I'm a huge fan of the Drinkwell products, we actually own 2 fountains with our 4 cats.This fountain holds plenty of water but my cats love the moving flow so much that we refill it daily.I am removing one start because it is a pain in the rear to clean. I use a small toothbrush to get the inside tube clean and also a small bottle brush.

title: Cat water fountain
body: My cat loves to drink out of the water faucet so I thought this would be good for him. He is a cat...so he decided he didn't like it although I sometimes catch him drinking from it when no one is watching.

title: very nice fountain, but a little loud
body: Very pleased with this product.  Very easy to use, it works well, my cats seem to like it.  The motor, however, is a little loud.  Certainly we have gotten used to it, but if you like real quiet, this will bug you.

title: IT WORKS!!
body: My cat is still slowly weaning off of the faucet, but he drinks out of the fountain. My cat never drank out of a water bowl, he would turn his nose up every time. Problem solved!

title: My cats ran away from it.
body: I bought the Drinkwell Pet Fountain for my 4 cats on the suggestion of my vet. They love playing in running water from the faucet so I thought they would like this fountain. When I turned it on they ran away. If it's not running they will drink from the bowl, but as soon as I plug it in they run away like it's some kind of cat eating alien. Might work as a cat deterrent in places you don't want them to hang out, like a flower bed or counter top. It seems to work OK and it's well made, but my cats are afraid of it.

title: Bought this for my cat and my dogs love it too
body: Bought this for my cat and my dogs love it too.  Wish it was bigger but would recommend it to anyone.

title: Dog's Delight
body: It works great, the dogs like it and it is really cool.  The unit is a bit hard to clean, I take out the filter and then I wash it.  When ordering the fountain get the bigger reservoir, because it is a stinker to refill, can't help but splashing water on the floor.

title: and then he fell in love with the waterfall
body: Our cat loves it. He was hesitant to drink from it, because he has always been drinking for a water bowl. I have to unplug the pump to stop the waterfall, and he would then drink from it. Basically, I tricked him by plugging in the plump while he was drinking from it. He realized that the waterfall does not 'endanger' him, and then he fell in love with the waterfall. Now, he drinks more water, which is good for him.

title: Five Stars
body: filtered water for our pets

title: Great
body: My cat loves this. He drank water alright before, but he's all over it now. I have to fill it up every other day.

title: the only bad thing about this bowl is that I cannot control ...
body: my animals had a hard time with tipping water bowls over and getting into other water sources that weren't appropriate for them, such as the toilet or open glasses we left out. Both of those behaviors have stopped since they've gotten this bowl. the only bad thing about this bowl is that I cannot control the flow of water as i should as it is described in the manual.

title: Even Pets Drink
body: Every pet should have clean water available, even in our busy household. We used our first Drinkwell Fountain until we burned out the motor, so this is our second one. We - and our cats - love this water fountain. I would never have pets without this; it is not right for us to have all the water we as humans want, and our pets do not. No pet owner should be without this water fountain!C

title: Get's very dirty VERY fast
body: Get's very dirty VERY fast. Very hard to clean. After a year mine has been making a strange / loud noise so I will be purchasing a different fountain for my cat in the near future.

title: Pet Fountain
body: My cat loves this fountain.  It had a very slight leak near the motor at first, but a little vaseline aound the seal took care of it.  My cat would only drink from the faucet and I knew he wasn't getting enough water.  This fountain was my miracle.  Thank you!

title: One Star
body: product is broke and does not wrk

title: Drink Fountain work great out of the box.
body: Just received and setup the Drinkwell Fountain for our 8 month old cat.  She was giving us a hard time with insisting that she drink water from the bathroom sink.  I couldn't shave or brush my teeth in the morning without her instance to have fresh water water to drink even though her usual bowl is change many times through the day.  After several review from Amazon.com and PetCo we decided to give this unit a go and was pleasantly surprised how quickly our Libby took to it and started using it right away.  Her curiosity got the best of her as she was entertained by the running water from the spout. she started to drink from it right away and thus far her insistance to use the bathroom sink has subsided.I took the unit apart to check the hardware configuration (okay I'm a man with tools and I love to tinker and take things apart to understand how they work) and was pleasantly surprised that the same pump used for our 20 gallon fish tank is used in this fountain.  I figure that if the same pump that has been working great for the past three years trouble free, then we can expect the same with the fountain.  Good solid and simple design.Feedback from other reviewers stated that there was some pump noise that would disturb their cats, but with the unit I got it was pretty much quiet.  The trickling water made more noise then the pump.  The supplied filter looks to be better quality.  I did rinse the one that came with the unit with cold water for several minutes to rinse out any loose carbon or filter media.  It came out pretty clean from the start.Cleaning the bowl looks to be pretty simple since it come apart fairly easy.Time will tell how this unit keeps our cat happy.I'd buy another one without hesitation.

title: My cats love this fountain
body: I have two fountains for three cats, and the kitties love them. I had to replace the first two fountains after about 3 years, and the newer version is much easier to take apart, clean, and put back together. Definitely recommended.

title: This is not like the other fountains I have purchased
body: This is not like the other fountains I have purchased.  It says it is the original but I have had one of these since 2002 and this is not the same.  It has a different pump and draws water from two places.  I had a corner fountain with a similar set up and it burned out on 3 months, I guess I will see how long this one lasts.  The real one lasts for years at a time, until I replaced it because of hard water deposits  built up so much it looked terrible.  Never had one break down.  I have three cats and they love it.

title: #loveit
body: Big bowl perfect for my pets!

title: Perfect for pets!
body: My cat loves running water, so this was the perfect solution for her. This is a great fountain. It's easy to clean and maintain.

title: Decent, but pointless on it's own
body: This unit really requires the reservoir add on, without it you'll be refilling it every few days (I have 2 cats). Also it doesn't quite keep the water flowing enough in the pan to keep sediment and hairs from settling at the bottom. It's not so bad that I'd bother getting a different unit, but I wouldn't recommend it to a friend.

title: Love this product
body: The stream comes out continuously with no glitches in the way it falls and it mimics the water coming out of a faucet just right. Very easy set up, basically rinse filter, insert into compartment, fill fountain with water and plug into the wall.  I really like the fact that it is wall powered because I can unplug it whenever I need to to save electricity if I'm not going to be home for long hours of the day. Another plus is that my cat still has a dish filled with water to drink from.

title: Five Stars
body: Works great! Thank you.

title: Not a good deal for me
body: Worked great for a month.  Then began making so much noise.  I tried taking it apart, putting it on a soft towel and finally broke it trying to get it to be more quiet.  I will avoid this one.

title: This is my second Drinkwell.
body: My cat is very happy with this drinking fountain. It runs all the time and it is well made and is easy to clean.

title: Cats love it. You have to clean and disassemble weekly
body: Works Very well.  Only thing i would add would be a filter over the water inlet since our furry animals gum up the pump slightly. you can take the pump apart by popping off the covers, and clean it. That is critical.  you have to clean this thing regularly.  Wash it in the dishwasher, but not on Hottest setting or plastic deforms. You HAVE to rinse it afterwards and i scrub it a bit.  Cats love it

title: Our cats are content now
body: We originally had one of these fountains.  We thought the cats would like a change, and it got a little stained no matter how much we cleaned it.  We bought three other types, but they still wanted to drink our of the faucet.  Ugh!  Got this again and I notice it is a little different and looks easier to clean.  I'm sure within a year or two it will stain again, but I will buy another.

title: Great Fountain, Even Better Price!!
body: So far, this fountain has been great. It took my dog abit of time to warm up to it, but now he's drinking from it fine. Only one small complaint...my dog has respiratory problems, so he has some mucus that gets in the water when he drinks from it which is not able to filter it out. Other then that, he seems to like it and the fountain is pretty tranquail😀

title: It died after a few months.
body: It ran great for a while, but after a few months, the stream ran down to just a trickle.

title: Drinkwell original pet fountain.
body: I bought this product in july and already barely working, just barely dribbles out. You have to change the filter way to often, I'd be filter poor if I kept using it. Very disappointed.

title: LEAKS
body: We have had a Drinkwell fountain like this one for over 10 years and wash and clean regularly.  It is EXTREMLY important to clean the fountain about every 2 or 3 weeks.  It has and does continue to work great.We bought this one originally as a back up but later decided to put it up as a second fountain for our 2 Pekingese and 5 Persians.  The new fountain leaks around the motor housing.  We checked out the O ring and even applied some silicon based sealant around the O ring to no avail.We were beyond the 30 day return date (our fault for not checking out the fountain earlier.... But we thought it was just to be a backup).The new fountain's plastic seems thinner than on our older version.Have decided to try the stainless steel Drinkwell 360 instead and hope to have better luck.

title: Good fountain but too noisy
body: This fountain is OK for the price, but it is very noisy because the motor vibrates against the case.My cats do enjoy drinking the fresh running water, which was the reason I purchased it.

title: As a veterinarian I recommend running water fountains for a variety of reasons and ...
body: Dependable fountain though some parts are harder to clean.  This is the third one I have bought.  First one lasted 4 years, the second is still running strong after 3 years, the third I wanted to get another as a second fountain for my furry family.  One of my cats had previously bat water in a dish around and got litter in the water, thus spoiling it for the others.  Now with a rather quiet source of running water this is no longer an issue.  As a veterinarian I recommend running water fountains for a variety of reasons and would not hesitate to recommend this particular model.

title: Our cats hate change but they liked this one!
body: All three of our cats were caught using it within the first 24 hours of having it out and running. They have not begged for water, even from the bathtub! Success!

title: Not worth it.
body: Its noisy and seems to go through the water quickly.  I've had better fountains.  I wouldn't buy it again.

title: good product
body: works well, keeps fresh water circulating for thirsty pets

title: Great size for my cat
body: The motor gets a little loud when the fountain is on wood. Great size for my cat. Just be sure to keep it clean!

title: A little noisy. . .
body: . . .but my cat seems to like drinking from them. She was reticent at first but after they ran for a few days and I changed the water a couple of times she seemed to warm up to the idea of the filtered water she was getting.

title: some cat may love it
body: it was far too loud in my room and the cat still prefers the drip from my gardening dripper hoses... it has become useless. it does work simply without interference and is reliable. too bad my cat doesn't like it. :(
